title: Tina Rosenberg on the Kidney Market in Iran
description: There is only one country in the world where a person can sell a kidney to another citizen who buys it. That country is Iran. Tina Rosenberg of The New York Times talks with EconTalk host Russ Roberts about the Iranian kidney market--how it works, its strengths and weaknesses, and whether its lessons apply to the United States or elsewhere.
author: webmaster@econlib.org (EconTalk: Russ Roberts)
